entry.et: Middle English, from Middle French preparer, from Latin praeparare, from prae- pre- + parare to procure, prepare pare

def.dt: :to make ready beforehand for some purpose, use, or activity prepare food for dinner
:to put in a proper state of mind is prepared to listen
:to work out the details of :plan in advance preparing a campaign strategy
:to put into written form prepare a report
:to get ready preparing for a career
